references.citationDetail: Enipeus: [1] Tributary to the right of the Alpheius [1] in Elis
references.formattedCitation: Hubert Cancik, Helmuth Schneider, Manfred Landfester, Christine F. Salazar, and Francis G. Gentry, eds. Brillâ€™s New Pauly: Encyclopaedia of the Ancient World. Brill, 2015. https://referenceworks.brillonline.com/browse/brill-s-new-pauly.

description: Located in ancient Elis, the Enipeus was a right tributary of the Alpheius, which it joined downstream (west) of ancient Olympia. It has been identified with the modern Lestenitsas.

properties.title: OSM Location of modern Lestenitsas Potamos
